title: E field of distribution - rod half pos half neg

content.question: Which integral expression could be solved to determine the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-component of the electric field at Point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mtext>P</mtext></math>, which is on the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis at position <math alttext="x equals lowercase d" overflow="scroll"> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mi>d</mi> </math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="negative k lambda times the integral from 0 to uppercase D, of, the fraction with numerator d x, and denominator open parenthesis, lowercase d minus x, close parenthesis squared end fraction plus k lambda times the integral from negative uppercase D to 0, of, the fraction with numerator d x, and denominator open parenthesis, lowercase d minus x, close parenthesis squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>−</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>λ</mi><munderover><mo>∫</mo><mn>0</mn><mi>D</mi></munderover><mfrac><mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>d</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>λ</mi><munderover><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>D</mi></mrow><mn>0</mn></munderover><mfrac><mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>d</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="negative k lambda times the integral from 0 to uppercase D, of, the fraction with numerator d x, and denominator, open parenthesis, lowercase d minus x, close parenthesis, squared, end fraction, minus k lambda times the integral from negative uppercase D to 0, of, the fraction with numerator d x, and denominator, open parenthesis, lowercase d minus x, close parenthesis, squared, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>k</mi><mi>λ</mi><munderover><mo>∫</mo><mn>0</mn><mi>D</mi></munderover><mfrac><mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>d</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>λ</mi><munderover><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>D</mi></mrow><mn>0</mn></munderover><mfrac><mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>d</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="k lambda times the integral from negative uppercase D to uppercase D, of, the fraction with numerator d x, and denominator lowercase d minus x, close parenthesis, squared, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>k</mi><mi>λ</mi><munderover><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>D</mi></mrow><mi>D</mi></munderover><mfrac><mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>d</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 k lambda times the integral from 0 to uppercase D, of, the fraction with numerator d x, and denominator, open parenthesis, lowercase d minus x, close parenthesis, squared, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><mi>k</mi><mi>λ</mi><munderover><mo>∫</mo><mn>0</mn><mi>D</mi></munderover><mfrac><mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>d</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="negative k lambda times the integral from 0 to uppercase D, of, the fraction with numerator d x, and denominator, open parenthesis, lowercase d minus x, close parenthesis, squared, end fraction, minus k lambda times the integral from negative uppercase D to 0, of, the fraction with numerator d x, and denominator, open parenthesis, lowercase d minus x, close parenthesis, squared, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>k</mi><mi>λ</mi><munderover><mo>∫</mo><mn>0</mn><mi>D</mi></munderover><mfrac><mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>d</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>λ</mi><munderover><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>D</mi></mrow><mn>0</mn></munderover><mfrac><mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>d</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
